title: ESA Weather Satellite to Launch Aboard Falcon 9 Today
summary: The European Space Agency’s AWS mission will be launched aboard a SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket later today on a mission to study Arctic weather. The Arctic Weather Satellite (AWS) is intended to be a prototype of a proposed constellation of small satellites called EPS-Sterna. If the constellation is launched, it will enable short-term, precise Arctic […]

title: SNC scaling up its fleet of radio-frequency monitoring satellites
summary: The company is transitioning from RF sensing cubesats to larger ESPA-class satellites

title: Hubble Rings in a New Galactic View
summary: The subject of this NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope image is situated in the Perseus Cluster, also known as Abell 426, 320 million light-years from Earth. It’s a barred spiral galaxy known as MCG+07-07-072, seen here among a number of photobombing stars that are much closer to Earth than it is. MCG+07-07-072 has quite an unusual shape for a […]

title: Make Space Great Again
summary: President Donald J. Trump transformed American space policy during his first term. He reestablished the National Space Council to coordinate national space strategy. He issued a series of important Space Policy […]

title: Rocket Lab’s Mars-bound twin satellites – Blue and Gold – hit the road ahead for Blue Origin launch
summary: The twin spacecraft, named Blue and Gold, left Rocket Lab’s Long Beach facilities on Thursday to begin the trip to Florida. The EscaPADE mission will launch aboard Blue Origin’s first New Glenn rocket.

title: SpaceX to launch Transporter-11 rideshare with 116 payloads
summary: On Friday, Aug. 15, 2024, SpaceX will launch the Transporter-11 rideshare mission from Space Launch Complex 4E (SLC-4E) at Vandenberg Space Force Base (VSFB). Liftoff is scheduled to occur at 11:20 AM PT (18:20 UTC), at the beginning of a 53-minute launch window. If needed, there is another launch opportunity the following day at the same time.

title: Long March 4B launches experimental Yaogan-43 satellite group
summary: HELSINKI — China successfully launched the first of a new group of Yaogan satellites Friday to test technologies for a low Earth orbit constellation. A Long March 4B rocket lifted […]

title: Arctic Weather Satellite: advancing weather forecasting in a changing climate
summary: The effects of the climate crisis are felt more acutely in the Arctic than anywhere else on the planet. The weather in the Arctic is not only severe, but it changes extremely quickly. More frequent data are urgently needed to improve weather forecasts for this susceptible polar region.

title: Indian solid SSLV rocket launches Earth observation satellite
summary: HELSINKI — India successfully launched its third SSLV Thursday, placing an Earth observation satellite into orbit and completing the solid rocket’s development process. The Small Satellite Launch Vehicle (SSLV) lifted […]

title: Watch Arctic Weather Satellite and Φsat-2 launch live
summary: ESA’s Arctic Weather Satellite and Φsat-2 missions are ready for lift-off from Vandenburg, California, with a target launch date of 16 August 2024.
